title: Three companies to buy most Virgin Orbit assets
summary: Three aerospace companies submitted winning bids at a bankruptcy auction for most of the assets of launch company Virgin Orbit, ending any chance that company could return to flight under new ownership.

title: BREAKING! Virgin Orbit Sells Assets To RocketLab, Stratolaunch and Vast Launcher
summary: Virgin Orbit has sold its assets and equipment to a trio of aerospace companies through an auction, as confirmed by a court filing released on Tuesday.

title: Virgin Orbit sells assets in bankruptcy auction to Rocket Lab, Stratolaunch and Vast’s Launcher
summary: Bankrupt rocket company Virgin Orbit sold its assets and equipment to a trio of aerospace companies in an auction, according to a court filing released on Tuesday.

title: NRO seeks closer ties with industry
summary: U.S. defense and intelligence agencies need to forge even closer ties with the commercial sector to address global security threats, said Chris Scolese, National Reconnaissance Office director.

title: Air Force Research Lab to fund development of Ursa Major’s rocket engines
summary: Rocket propulsion startup Ursa Major won a U.S. Air Force Research Laboratory contract to support the development of two of the company’s rocket engines.

title: The Spaceport Company Performs First Demo of Offshore Launch Ops
summary: The Spaceport Company has successfully demonstrated their capability to conduct launches from a floating platform in US territorial waters for the first time.

title: Astrobotic To Provide Blue Moon Lander Cargo Systems
summary: Astrobotic to provide cargo systems as part of the Blue Origin National Team's, who won NASA's Sustainable Human Landing System Contract for the Artemis program last week.

title: The Spaceport Company demonstrates offshore launch operations
summary: Two companies have demonstrated the ability to conduct launches from a floating platform in U.S. territorial waters, a concept that could help address congestion at terrestrial launch sites.

title: Orbital Sidekick acquires first light imagery
summary: Hyperspectral startup Orbital Sidekick is acquiring imagery from its first two satellites launched in April on the SpaceX Transporter-7 rideshare flight.

title: L3Harris wins IARPA HAYSTAC contract
summary: L3Harris Technologies announced a contract May 22 from the Intelligence Advanced Research Projects Activity to provide technology to help characterize and predict human mobility.
